text: William Thomas Porter, S.M.A. (14 May 1887 – 16 June 1966) was an English Roman Catholic missionary priest, bishop and archbishop, who served as Vicar Apostolic of Gold Coast and later Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Cape Coast in present-day Ghana. He was appointed vicar apostolic (as well as titular bishop of Urusi) on 25 April 1933 and archbishop on 18 Apr 1950. He retired as archbishop on 15 May 1959. ==Schools== In 1936, Porter established a Roman Catholic secondary school, St. Augustine's College in Cape Coast. He also established several Roman Catholic youth groups. ==References== Category:1887 births Category:1966 deaths Category:Roman Catholic missionaries in Ghana Category:English Roman Catholic missionaries Category:Ghanaian Roman Catholic archbishops Category:English Roman Catholic archbishops Category:Cape Coast Category:British expatriates in Ghana Category:Gold Coast (British colony) people Category:20th-century Roman Catholic archbishops
title: William Porter (archbishop)
